abilities.description: Allows the user to create green gel-like collars that can be placed on any living creature, granting absolute control over them through verbal commands.
limitations: Victims must be able to hear the user's commands for the control to work
Victims retain consciousness and awareness while under control
Strong-willed individuals may be able to resist commands
All collars disappear if the user loses consciousness
Collars can be dodged by fast opponents

abilities.description: The collars can unlock and amplify the full potential of controlled creatures, forcing them to use their maximum power.
The user can place a collar on themselves to enhance their own physical abilities. When self-applied, the collar glows bright red.

weaknesses.description: Commands only work if victims can hear them. Earplugs or soundproof barriers can completely nullify the control.
If the user loses consciousness, all active collars immediately shatter and disappear, freeing all controlled victims.
The user is vulnerable to seawater and Seastone, though the collars themselves can function underwater.

keyMoments.title: Peto Peto no Mi Powers Revealed
keyMoments.description: Breed demonstrates his Devil Fruit ability for the first time by placing control collars on Chopper and forcing him into Monster Point.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes the primary threat of the Caesar Retrieval Arc.

keyMoments.title: Controls Multiple Powerful Fighters
keyMoments.description: Breed successfully places collars on both Luffy and Law, demonstrating his ability to control even strong opponents.
keyMoments.significance: Shows that the fruit's power can affect even high-level combatants.

trivia: The name 'Peto Peto' comes from the Japanese onomatopoeia for the sound of patting or petting an animal.
Luffy mistakenly identifies this power as belonging to a 'slime human' because it sounds like 'petopeto' (sticky), which coincidentally foreshadows Trebol's Beta Beta no Mi.
This is an anime-only Devil Fruit and is not considered canon to the manga storyline.
Despite being a Paramecia fruit about controlling pets, it works equally well on humans, making its name somewhat misleading.
